Also out
Into The Woods
aaaa
2015 / From Now / Cert PG

Rob Marshall’s star-swollen adaptation of Sondheim’s fairy-tale remix makes a sporting but wayward swipe at its Broadway subversions. Corden, Blunt, Streep, Kendrick et al gamely go at the swooning numbers and quizzical asides, but the unravelling happy endings and clever-cleverness prove increasingly unmanageable. IN

Watch Trailer
Selma
aaaaa
2015 / From Now / Cert PG

The most tragically relevant film of this year’s Oscars, Selma is an ensemble story of the historic civil-rights marches that forced change in the US. David Oyelowo’s Martin Luther King Jr. is the standout, while the carefully composed direction of Ava DuVernay makes the bubbling anger that drives characters and film all the more powerful. HOH

Watch Trailer
The Gambler
aaa
2015 / From Now / Cert PG

After departing his rebooted Planet Of The Apes, Rupert Wyatt re-emerged with this low-key, ’70s-remake thriller. It confirmed his stylistic strength, if not his ambition. It’s Mark Wahlberg’s show, really, as his gambling English Lit lecturer (!) is given seven days to pay back a loan shark. Talky, grown-up and morally murky, but a minor work. WT

Watch Trailer
A Most Violent Year
aaaaa
2015 / From Now / Cert PG

Assured, elegant and gripping, J. C. Chandor’s ’81 New York-set drama is notable for being an anti-crime movie, its protagonist (Oscar Isaac’s heating-oil company owner) a rare example of a character keen to triumph without breaking the rules. It provides further proof that Chandor is one of the most exciting filmmakers working today. DJ

Watch Trailer
